subject: Home & DIY
title: LED Lights Changed Everything
description: A short lesson to help you apply LED Lights Changed Everything.

hook.text: A single LED bulb uses 75% less energy than an incandescent and lasts 25 times longer. The math is staggering.

buildup.text: Incandescent bulbs waste 90% of energy as heat. They're essentially heaters that happen to produce some light.

discovery.text: LEDs convert electricity directly to light using semiconductors. Almost no energy is wasted as heat.

twist.text: Replacing every bulb in an average home with LEDs saves $225 per year. The bulbs pay for themselves within 3 months.

climax.text: Global LED adoption has cut lighting electricity 40%. It's the single fastest energy transition in human history.

punchline.text: The most impactful climate action fits in a socket.

quiz.question: Why are incandescent bulbs so energy-inefficient?
options: They waste 90% of energy as heat instead of light
They require more voltage than LED circuits provide
Their filaments degrade and lose efficiency over weeks
